intro: Thrixspermum williamsianum, commonly known as the Williams' thrixspermum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Thrixspermum williamsianum is typically found in moist, rocky habitats at high elevations.
